item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Tuesday, October 22, 2024 at 2:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. World-First Starlink Service on Boeing 777 Launched by Qatar Airways (21 points | 16 comments)
2. Tog's Paradox (47 points | 24 comments)
3. One Plus One Equals Two (2006) (39 points | 8 comments)
4. Show HN: Ambulate – Detailed Trip Planning (9 points | 3 comments)
5. Math is still catching up to the genius of Ramanujan (595 points | 289 comments)
6. First images from Euclid are in (854 points | 249 comments)
7. MQTT turns 25 (163 points | 38 comments)
8. Against /Tmp (77 points | 46 comments)
9. Raku Programming Language (25 points | 5 comments)
10. MixRank (YC S11) Is Hiring Software Engineers and Ex-Founders Globally ( | hide)
11. Understanding Gaussians (70 points | 7 comments)
12. LTESniffer: An Open-Source LTE Downlink/Uplink Eavesdropper (205 points | 27 comments)
13. Just want simple TLS for your .internal network? (127 points | 54 comments)
14. Advice for first-time inventors from a patent engineer (48 points | 29 comments)
15. Learning to Learn (164 points | 69 comments)
16. Writing a Mathematica Interpreter in Typescript (86 points | 8 comments)
17. An amateur historian has discovered a long-lost short story by Bram Stoker (287 points | 109 comments)
18. Probabalistic Spin Glass (2022) (15 points | 1 comment)
19. Show HN: Data Formulator – AI-powered data visualization from Microsoft Research (165 points | 21 comments)
20. A Controversial Rare-Book Dealer Tries to Rewrite His Own Ending (56 points | 18 comments)
21. Civet: A Superset of TypeScript (182 points | 160 comments)
22. Malcolm Gladwell Holds His Ideas Loosely. He Thinks You Should, Too (20 points | 23 comments)
23. Building a Game with the Real Engine (99 points | 25 comments)
24. Scalene: A high-performance, high-precision CPU, GPU, memory profiler for Python (147 points | 14 comments)
25. New discovery reveals how diatoms capture CO2 so effectively (94 points | 23 comments)
26. Mind Wandering: More than a Bad Habit (2018) [pdf] (112 points | 58 comments)
27. Overengineering a way to know if people are in my university's CS lab (167 points | 76 comments)
28. Singapore OKs 4,300km subsea cable for importing electricity from Australia (69 points | 85 comments)
29. When machines could see you (15 points | 1 comment)
30. A near impossible literacy test Louisiana used to suppress the black vote (190 points | 213 comments)
